intro: [WRONG START] Daucus carota var. Hollandica, commonly known as the Dutch carrot, is a variety of the wild carrot plant native to Europe. It features slender, cylindrical roots that are typically lighter in color compared to the orange roots of the domesticated carrot. The plant produces small, white flowers arranged in umbels, which are characteristic of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, aromatic scent. This variety is often found in grassy areas and along roadsides, thriving in disturbed soils.
